item.title: About me
item.description: Key facts Name: Konstantin Pinkl Age: 25 Nationality: German Education Training qualification: Industrial clerk at Vaillant GmbH A-levels: Berufliche Oberschule Schwandorf Bachelor: Bachelor of Science (Business Administration) at LMU Munich Master: Master of Science (Masters in Financial Analysis) at London Business School Professional Experience Deloitte GmbH: Intern | Financial Advisory, Sport Business Group UniCredit AG: Intern | Investment Banking, M&A, ECM Deutsche Bank AG: Summer Analyst | Investment Banking, M&A, ECM

item.title: Climate change and temperature anomalies
item.description: Aproach weather <- read_csv("https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v3/NH.Ts+dSST.csv", skip = 1, na = "***") weather_selected <- select(weather, Year:Dec) weather_selected_long <- weather_selected %>% pivot_longer(cols = 2:13, #columns 2 to 13 names_to = "Month", values_to = "delta") tidyweather <- weather_selected_long %>% mutate(date = ymd(paste(as.character(Year), Month, "1")), month = month(date, label=TRUE), year = year(date)) ggplot(tidyweather, aes(x=date, y = delta))+ geom_point()+ geom_smooth(color="red") + theme_bw() + labs ( title = "Weather Anomalies" ) Is the effect of increasing temperature more pronounced in some months?

item.title: Worldwide spirits consumption analysis
item.description: .. beers, wine and other spirits! Approach ADD knitr::opts_chunk$set( message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, tidy=FALSE, # display code as typed size="small") # slightly smaller font for code options(digits = 3) # default figure size knitr::opts_chunk$set( fig.width=6.75, fig.height=6.75, fig.align = "center" ) Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) #Load in the dataset from the fivethirtyeight package glimpse(drinks) #Glimpse() the dataset in order to preview the data entries themselves ## Rows: 193 ## Columns: 5 ## $ country <chr> "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", ".
